repnme.cdata!:
Benin - Education for All-Fast Track
            Initiative Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Education for All - Fast
            Track Initiative Program for Benin rated as follows: the
            outcomes were moderately unsatisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory and Grantee performance was
            moderately unsatisfactory. The lessons learned are twofold.
            One, it is important to take the suggestions of various
            different types of beneficiaries seriously. Two, it is
            important to note that it is possible to derive a high
            degree of satisfaction from beneficiaries through actions
            that do not cost anything. Improvements in these two areas
            would revitalize and strengthen existing management and
            operation structures (with the technical support of local
            councils), making them more efficient.

repnme.cdata!:
Benin - Education for All-Fast Track
            Initiative Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Education for All-Fast Track Initiative Project for Benin is
            to contribute to expanding equitable access to pre-school
            and primary education and to supporting the development of
            literacy programs, while improving quality and retention at
            primary level as well as the management of the sector. The
            extension will allow the project to complete the following
            activities, which are crucial to the full attainment of the
            project development objective (PDO): (i) construction of
            schools, latrines and literacy centers that experienced
            delays due to heavy rain, affecting the number of project
            beneficiaries and percentage of females; (ii) literacy
            activities for which the signing of the contracts with some
            non-government organizations (NGOs) is finally underway,
            affecting the number of people to pass an initial or
            post-literacy training; (iii) teacher training, affecting
            the number of additional qualified teachers; and (iv) the
            establishment of a computerized framework for a subsequent
            full information management system. The closing date of the
            project will be extension from December 30, 2011 to June 15, 2012.

12675554.trustfund:
TF091947-BENIN: EDUCATION FOR ALL - FAST
            TRACK INITIATIVE CATALYTIC FUND

repnme.cdata!:
Benin - Education for All-Fast Track
            Initiative Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Education for All-Fast Track Initiative Project for Benin is
            to contribute to expanding equitable access to pre-school
            and primary education and to supporting the development of
            literacy programs, while improving quality and retention at
            primary level as well as the management of the sector. The
            project implementation has been refocused on the activities
            which: (i) directly contribute to the achievement of the
            project development objective; (ii) have begun start-up
            activities that make their completion by the new closing
            date realistic; and (iii) require international financial
            support. The activities are newly introduced or modified are
            the following: (i) providing direct support to pre-primary
            and primary public schools for teaching materials and
            operating costs; and (ii) supporting a program of daily
            nutrition assistance in preprimary and primary public
            schools (501 school canteens are concerned) instead of
            building 180 new canteens as originally planned.
